image.altText: A man in a tracksuit top gets out of a car with 'L' plates on it in a busy street

props.synopsis: A Four Corners and Guardian Australia investigation identifies two men wanted by Rwandan authorities.

title.children: Australian driving instructor wanted by Rwandan authorities for alleged involvement in genocide

image.altText: A young woman with glasses pensively staring at a computer.

props.synopsis: Overtime is an increasingly vexed issue with some workers pushed to the brink by unreasonable unpaid work. But how many additional hours are too many? When should employees be paid for extra work?

title.children: Is it overtime or overwork? How to tell if your work hours are reasonable — and if you should get paid extra

image.altText: A composite image of murder victims Luke Davies (left) and Jesse Baird

props.synopsis: The area being searched for the bodies of Luke Davies and Jesse Baird is hundreds of kilometres away from the initial search locations in Sydney and Newcastle.

title.children: Police search for dead couple moves to remote area south-west of Sydney

image.altText: Composite image Mechelle Turvey in red and white swirl top in front of a montage of images of her son, Cassius

props.synopsis: Mechelle Turvey went through the worst thing a mother can endure. When the senseless death of her 15-year-old son Cassius Turvey ignited fury across the nation, she instead called for peace and unity.

title.children: When Mechelle's son Cassius Turvey died after an alleged attack she chose empathy

image.altText: A man in scrubs stands in a medical room.

props.synopsis: A prominent Brisbane surgeon used a woman in a human trial without her written consent while operating on a hernia that may have never existed, medical board documents reveal.

title.children: Sally never gave written consent to be involved in a human trial for hernia mesh. A surgeon used her anyway

image.altText: Charred bushland following a fire

props.synopsis: Heartbreak and miraculous saves take place in western Victoria as a huge fire roars through 17,000 hectares.

title.children: Catastrophic fire danger looms in Victoria as bushfire continues to burn

image.altText: Taylor Swift close up on stage, smiling

props.synopsis: It isn't just celebrities who are being victimised with "deepfake" explicit images — cybercrime experts say others, including children and teenagers, are increasingly being targeted too.

title.children: Taylor Swift was a victim of deepfake pornography, but cybercrime experts say she is far from alone

image.altText: Several people walking past a large ship, as the Sydney Harbour Bridge can be seen in the background

props.synopsis: Leon Fink wants the multi-billion-dollar general insurance industry to be held accountable for its brutal treatment of businesses during COVID-19 lockdowns, writes Adele Ferguson.

title.children: Leon Fink paid premiums for years. When COVID lockdowns shuttered his business, his insurer refused his claim

image.altText: A paramilitary police officer speaks to a group of Chinese primary school students.

props.synopsis: China has been implementing a nationwide patriotic education campaign in schools for decades, but it is now also targeting those living overseas. How will it work in Australia?

title.children: Beijing implements patriotic education law targeting Chinese people living overseas

image.altText: illustration of a sign that reads danger asbestos and two men wearing white hazmat suits in front of Sydney skyline

props.synopsis: More than a month before asbestos was first detected near the Rozelle Interchange, an auditor warned that testing on some mulch at another site just metres away was "non-compliant".

title.children: Auditor raised warning about 'non-compliant' mulch testing near asbestos-contaminated parklands

image.altText: A semi-trailer lies on its side in red dirt

props.synopsis: As residents on Western Australia's asses the damage caused by Cyclone Lincoln, Australians are being told such weather systems are only set to become more severe.

title.children: Australians warned to expect fewer but more ferocious cyclones

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese speaks to the press club in a stern, close-up shot

props.synopsis: Strategists on the progressive side of politics are becoming increasingly anxious about the role right-wing lobby group Advance could play in future elections — starting with this weekend's by-election in Dunkley, writes Patricia Karvelas.

title.children: Right-wing lobby group Advance is back in Dunkley, as audacious as ever

image.altText: Smoke rises from a train station hit by a Russian missile strike in Ukraine as people stand nearby

props.synopsis: The defence minister of Ukraine says half of promised Western military support to the country fails to arrive on time, ultimately costing the lives of its soldiers.

title.children: Ukraine's defence minister says delays in promised Western military aid cost lives

image.altText: CSIRO research vessel Investigator at sea

props.synopsis: The RV Investigator allows scientists to monitor climate change, map the sea floor and discover new marine species. But a $34 million funding shortfall will see its research operations slashed by a third in the coming years.

title.children: Voyages scrapped as funding shortfall impacts Australia’s state-of-the-art marine research ship

image.altText: Donald Trump kisses the American flag on stage at a conference

props.synopsis: Seconds after polls closed, Donald Trump was declared victorious in Nikki Haley's home state – shattering the prospects of his only remaining rival. But she's not giving up yet.

title.children: 'You're fired, Joe': Confident Trump revives reality TV persona after big win in South Carolina

image.altText: A line of new houses with identically coloured black roofs.

props.synopsis: As more high-income households have shifted into the private rental market, low-income renters are struggling to complete and many are retreating into informal living arrangements, Gareth Hutchens writes.

title.children: More 'rich' households are renting, and low-income renters are struggling to compete

image.altText: A graphic showing various colourful bubbles imposed over an image of a classroom.

props.synopsis: Universities could soon be facing major funding changes as the biggest review of the sector in decades calls for a radical reshaping of the tertiary education sector.

title.children: Long-awaited report recommends sweeping changes to tertiary education

image.altText: Sam Powell-Pepper stands over Mark Brake after bumping into him and hitting him high

props.synopsis: In our first look at semi-competitive footy for the year, we saw the league's concussion crackdown put to an early test, North Melbourne unleash their new brand of attacking footy and some bright signs from draftees. Here are five quick hits from the weekend's match sims.

title.children: Five quick hits — SPP in MRO strife, 'Northball' and some rising stars headline AFL scratch matches

image.altText: Billie Meryl and Pedro

props.synopsis: Oppenheimer wins best cast in a motion picture to continue its dominance this season ahead of the Oscars. Follow live.

title.children: SAG awards best moments: Fan favourites reunite, 'drunk' acceptance speech and a reignited Oscars race

image.altText: Sperm injection process

props.synopsis: When a hospital patient wandered into a US fertility clinic and destroyed frozen embryos, they caused a chain of events that led to a major court ruling. It's left the IVF sector reeling, and patients in limbo.

title.children: A hospital patient dropped frozen embryos onto a clinic floor. What followed has rocked IVF in the US

image.altText: Lieutenant General Michelle McGuinness

props.synopsis: The federal government taps a 30-year veteran of the Australian military to be the next national cyber security coordinator.

title.children: Governmment taps senior military figure as new cyber security coordinator

image.altText: Jordan Thompson holding a two-layer trophy in both hands, with pyrotechnics in the background.

props.synopsis: After 11 years, Jordan Thompson wins his first ATP Tour title with a straight-sets victory over  Casper Ruud to lift the trophy in Los Cabos, Mexico.

title.children: Jordan Thompson wins first ATP Tour title, defeating Ruud in Mexico final

image.altText: A drone photo of flood water

props.synopsis: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Lincoln crossed the WA coast at the town of Carnarvon, delivering rain to a region that's dealt with successive heatwaves, but also damaging crops.

title.children: Drought-breaking for some, heart-breaking for others: Tropical low hits WA coast, bringing heavy rain

image.altText: Mudjimba Island off Queensland's Sunshine Coast.

props.synopsis: A man believed to be in his 60s dies after becoming distressed while swimming with his daughter on an unpatrolled beached at North Mudjimba, the second drowning on the Sunshine Coast in the past week.

title.children: Man dies off Sunshine Coast beach while swimming with daughter

image.altText: Old photo of ship

props.synopsis: The discovery of a ship lost off Wollongong 120 years ago sparks calls for relatives of those lost to come forward.

title.children: Ship searching for sunken containers stumbles upon 120-year-old shipwreck

image.altText: A burger in a bun with green avocado, green lettuce, red tomato and sauce and brown patty sits on a wooden chopping board

props.synopsis: If you're thinking about buying plant-based foods there are plant-based burgers, sausages and mince. The fridges are loaded with non-dairy milk, cheese and yoghurt. Then there are the tins of beans and packets of tofu. But how much is actually healthy?

title.children: We looked at 700 plant-based foods to see how healthy they really are. Here’s what we found

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: I s'pose you think you'll get these trivia questions right — for a change. Well, let's see about that.

title.children: Do you like your Sunday coffee with a side of shame? I've got the quiz for you

image.altText: A sketch shows the planned look of a new railway station.

props.synopsis: A long-awaited rail line connecting the Sunshine Coast, Moreton Bay and Brisbane is a step closer to construction after the Queensland government has committed almost $3 billion towards the first stage of the project.

title.children: 'Mega project': Biggest passenger rail line announced for Sunshine Coast

image.altText: Australia's T20 team huddles around the Chappell-Hadlee Trophy

props.synopsis: Australia endures three rain delays on its way to a clean sweep of its T20I series with New Zealand, posting a 27-run win in Auckland.

title.children: Australia completes T20 series sweep of New Zealand in rain-shortened game three

image.altText: Composite of a man wearing an orange mankini while on a horse

props.synopsis: Australian Sports Commission chief executive Kieran Perkins finds no humour in the sight of three-time Olympic equestrian Shane Rose appearing in a mankini, describing the incident as setting a poor example.

title.children: 'Horrified' Olympic great Kieran Perkins condemns equestrian's mankini incident

image.altText: A composite photo of four celebrities

props.synopsis: The SAG awards usually offer up a blend of looks that are bold, but more elegant than the wackiness we saw on the Grammys red carpet. Here are some of the looks we've seen so far.

title.children: Screen Actors Guild red carpet: It's the era of abstract cut outs, slits, cheeky sheers and a battle of the wraps
